text: Clarence Eugene "Hank" Snow (May 9, 1914 – December 20, 1999) was a Canadian- American country music artist. He was very popular in the 1950s. His career lasted for more than 50 years. He recorded 140 albums and 85 singles.Hank Snow with Jack Ownbey and Bob Burris. (1994) The Hank Snow Story: Hank Snow, the Singing Ranger. Urbana, Illinois: University of Illinois Press. == References == == Bibliography == * Wolfe, Charles. (1998). "Hank Snow". In The Encyclopedia of Country Music. Paul Kingsbury, Editor. New York: Oxford University Press. pp. 494–5. == Other websites == * * Hank Snow at the Country Music Hall of Fame * Hank Snow discography at Discogs.com * Hank Snow Tribute Song * Rev. title: Hank Snow
